question: Until today, I did not know that there were ANY weight loss drugs in use aside from Meridia and Xenical (now alli OTC.)I am insterested in learning more about my options, but would like to consult a physician as well.I just learned about HCG.  I did not know doctors were still prescribing phentermine or phendimetrazine.I am morbidly obese and have diabetes.  I am also infertile due to PCOS.  My weight has been a burden for a long time and I must find something that will stick.  (I usually struggle tremendously to just lose 8-10 pounds and give up.)The way I see it, I have to calculate the risks.  What is the risk of staying at my current weight?  I am 35 and would like a long healthy life ahead of me.Thanks!(Note to fightu:  I have just joined this forum today.  I see that you are very passionately campaigning against diet drugs.  I just wanted to let you know that the repetitive messages, angry tone and impression of "ranting" have greatly discredited any information you provide.  This is actually very unfortunate, because if anything you include is factual, it would be valuable for people to read.  Please consider approaching your "crusade" from a more rational standpoint.  You may find that you can genuinely help people.)
